request.description: Within the config file, you are required to determine the number of previously used passwords a User is not allowed to use anymore by setting password.check_all to TRUE/FALSE or to an int value and password.number to a corresponding int value as well. You can choose to notify a User whenever a password is changed by setting password.notify.change to TRUE

To enable Two-Factor Authentication for the User,
he/she must sync the Shared Secret between its Authenticator
app and the application.
Recovery codes will be generated if code is invalid.
To disable Two-Factor Authentication for the User.
The User can retrieve current recovery codes.

The User can generate a fresh batch of codes which replaces
the previous batch.
Every staff need to be assigned a branch to work from.

Fetch a record or records from the user table. The id param is optional but can either be a string|null|int If the id has a null value the records will be paginated. The returned page size is be set from api.paginate.user_kyc.pageSize config. If the id is a string value it can only be set as 'all'. This will return all the records without being paginated. If the id value is an integer it will try to fetch a single matching record.

Fetch a record or records from the user table. The id param is optional but can either be a string|null|int If the id has a null value the records will be paginated. The returned page size is be set from api.paginate.user.pageSize config. If the id is a string value it can only be set as 'all'. This will return all the records by user model without being paginated. If the id value is an integer it will try to fetch a single matching record.

If the id value is an integer it will try to fetch a single matching record.

This API logs a user out of a single session
This API logs a user out of every session and clears all user tokens

query.description: id Field must belong to a registered User.

request.description: This endpoint is used to generate and send via email a URL for User email verification to a registered User.

Within the config file, you are required to determine whether a user should recieve welcome and verification emails after registration by setting registration.notify.welcome to TRUE and registration.notify.verify to TRUE respectively. You can also set registration.autologin to TRUE.

You can choose to notify a User whenever there has been a Login by setting password.notify.change to TRUE Within the config file, Make sure to retrieve access_token after login for User authentication

variable.description:
<small class="badge badge-blue">id</small>
Field must belong to a registered User.

request.description: This endpoint must have a valid laravel generated URL signature to work. It is automatically sent after a successful registration and registration.notify.verify is set to TRUE within the config file.
The user must enter a registered email.
